title: Stop acting like every champion will suddenly start the game with Sated Devourer
body:
If you normally go cinderhulk, you aren't just magically getting sated devourer as well.  If you normally go warrior, you still aren't magically getting sated devourer.  

**Stop acting like champions like Shen or Rengar will be stronger because they have an on-hit effect.**

Yeah, there will be some strong cases.  But people are acting like everyone with an on-hit effect is being buffed.  Many of them need the AD and CDR of warrior.  Many of them need the tankiness of Cinderhulk.  Before you say this item is too strong, consider that they're choosing to buy no AD and no tankiness just to get attack speed and on-hit damage...until Sated turns on.  But then it starts falling off compared to crit builds late-game anyway.  It's a strong item but you sacrifice a lot early and late game to buy it.

You wouldn't say, "OMG Cinderhulk is gonna make master yi broken with all that health!!" Because 99% of the time, he absolutely would not buy it.

 So stop saying things like, "OMG new Devourer is gonna make X-Tank (who only ever builds Cinderhulk) broken with all those free on-hit effects!!"

Just my 2 cents.

I have a question. I dont fully understand how this item works. So it says on hit effects does that mean if Akali were to jungle (Not saying she would or will) and I threw my q on a monster and proc my q with a basic attack the q damage is 2ce the effect? Or if I use W on elise in spider form does that mean I get double the attack speed? Im really confused about this item. And how does it work with other items? Lich Bane/Tri force? I am very confused.
Nope and rengar and shen don't proc it either because it's an AA enhancement and is consumed after 1 hit, it doesn't stack upon itself.

in shens case his autos reduce the cd of his passive 
if his shield is active its a double the cd reduction for his passive 

so with sated dewourer shen might just activate his passive 4 times as fast with shield active on top of a permanent 2x

akali wouldnt get the second q 
but her on hit passive would proc twice resulting in loads of magic damage per hit 

elise wouldnt get more atack speed she would deal twice as much magic dmg per hit and probably heal twice as much

i dont know what rengar has to gain from this 

but there are cases where this item causes bull crap interactions 

also udyr ... phoenix every second hit ... double tiger damage per hit 
udyr was a king of the old dewourer meta .. this will rocket launch him even further


 also double muramana proc is possible 
thats just a lot of bull crap stacked on even a bigger pile of crap

Hey. Why has no one mentioned {{champion:266}}  yet?

His W is the reason why i might bring him back into the jungle again after this goes live.

Every third basic attack sacrifices life for an empowered strike or for life steal. imagine the double damage proc or heals on the 3rd strike.

this might actually give him enough sustain and damage to be viable again.

Thats not how this works, Sated Devourer only uses two on hit effects, it won't double an auto attack enhancer.

On Aatrox it will not double the damage, but it will double the counter. So he get's his W on every second attack.

Still really strong, 
33% more sustain or damage is alot
He'd actually proc his W every other attack. But the damage/heal wouldn't be doubled.

But if he procs Blood Price every other attack, he'll also *take* damage faster.  And less of it will be compensated by lifesteal; you can't lifesteal from Phantom Hit because it only triggers on-hits, *not* your actual Attack Damage.

Still useful in the right situation, though, and he does like the stats.
life steal counts as an onhit effect
If the hit does NO DAMAGE, there is nothing to life-steal
Unless they have a botrk xD

generally you only use blood price when you are above 50% health, under 50% health you switch to the Heal.

So you have more innitial damage and then more safety.

> [{quoted}](name=Hagane No Arashi,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jYEIeGfm,comment-id=00000000000000010000,timestamp=2015-06-28T01:11:33.565+0000)
>

> if sated dewourer would make runaans bolts count as 2 too ... then it would be hell (thou i doubt it)

{{item:3085}} bolts build charges for {{item:3087}}, and I'm pretty sure the Phantom Hit does too, so it would be something like every other auto attack. Plus, the bolts apply the on-hit effects of Devourer

But, just like Statikk Shiv, Phantom Hit will probably not proc the actual effect (though it will charge it) on the bolts. Also, it won't pre-emptively charge it, either.

For instance, on Statikk Shiv, if you have 95 charges and auto, theoretically you could see yourself hitting your main attack and tossing a lightning bolt off of a Runaan bolt. However, it *will not* because it simply charges to 100, and then it will wait until a full autoattack later to finally release it on your main attack. And then, once you do proc your Shiv, the bolts will not charge up the Shiv afterward until a full autoattack later.

Because of this, it's most likely that Phantom Hit will adopt similar mechanics, and will A. only effect your main attack and B. still take a full autoattack to charge. You will get 4 autos every other attack, and 3 autos on the others, adding just 1 auto (without damage) per 2 attacks, just as regular Phantom Hit works without Runaan's.

> [{quoted}](name=Terchio,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jYEIeGfm,comment-id=0000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-06-28T04:07:38.004+0000)

You will get 4 autos every other attack, and 3 autos on the others, adding just 1 auto (without damage) per 2 attacks, just as regular Phantom Hit works without Runaan's.

- auto attack = 10 charges
- 2 bolts = 20 charges
- phantom hit = 10 charges
- phantom hit bolts = 20 charges (assuming the bolts apply charges)

So the first hit will apply a total of 30 charges for Stattik Shiv, the second one with Phantom Hit will apply 60 charges, for a total of 90 charges every other auto attack. Moving also applies 5 charges per 100 units, so if you're moving while attacking you could get a Stattik Shiv proc every third auto attack, otherwise it would be every fourth while it charged from 90 to 100 on the third auto attack

And then 3 lightning bolts will shoot out of Statikk Shiv...

No, that's not how it works. Charge skills as a whole only activate on the main attack. Phantom hit most likely will be no different. You can dream, I suppose, but I promise you, you will be getting only 40 charges every other autoattack, not 60.

I didn't say that the bolts or phantom hit bolts would proc the lightning, I said they'll add charges, assuming phantom hit also shoots bolts.

And my point was that Phantom Hit won't proc on bolts, as no other charge effect does; Not Cait Headshot, nor Shiv, nor TF cards, nothing. Charges will go up, but only main attack will proc, meaning it will always go 40-30-40 or 30-40-30, not a huge step up from Runaan's 30-30-30. Not worth, unless they took a crazy vacation from their typical antics.

Heck, is 60-30-60 isn't even worth... it's 1 attack short from the typical Runaan/Statikk build. 4 shot Statikk isn't worth the same as 3 BotRK per 2 shots. Not even close.
however, in shen's case he gets better dps with cinderhulk, what with his enhanced auto scaling off of health for damage, as well as the aoe passive.

it depends 

shen scales of health but the cooldown of his passive itself is strictly tied to autoatacks 

with sated dewourer its possible for shen to activate his passive every 2 or 3 autoatacks with his shield up 
since his cooldown on that passive is 9/8/7 seconds 
with sated dewourer every auto will reduce it by 2 per hit 
with shield up he gets either 4 or he gets 3 seconds reduciton 
so its either 3 hits or 2 hits 


if we assume that shen might cast it insanely frequently ... then it will outshadow cinderhulk by far 

but its just a speculation ... we wont know until its implemented (i hope its not)

let's do some math with this then, assuming shen has his boots and a build consisting of jungle item and another item, if you go without cinder you probably are getting sunfire to boost clear, and otherwise lets say randuins because it gives similar stats.
Lets arbitrarily say that combat is taking place for 5 seconds. lets also ignore abilities, but say shen is lvl 9.

At 5 seconds Cinderhulk shen does 102 damage Aoe, attacks 4 times for a total of 332 damage, and his passive hits once for 140. total damage output = 574

At 5 seconds Devourer shen does 170 damage aoe, attacks 6 times for a total of 498 damage, procs devourer 9 times for 540 and his passive hits twice for 170. total damage output = 1378

I can say my initial decision was incorrect, but lets look at some other variables that are still important, first I let the lvl 9 shen have a sated devourer, which would be something near impossible to achieve, second the devourer shen is not half as tanky as the cinderhulk shen, and also doesn't have the same healing capability the tanky shen has. this also takes into place the version of devourer on pbe, so it might change on release.

after all this, I'm still gonna say cinderhulk is better on shen, because it brings more utility and tankiness, but I will again consent to being wrong about the dps.

you disregarded other abilities 
which costed shen another passive proc

yeah ... cinderhulk synergizes better with him 
but still we are talking about a thing that is still on pbe 
if it proves to make shen a beast ... people will find tankyness elswhere
the question is how potent will that cheese be

>I have a question. I dont fully understand how this item works. So it says on hit effects does that mean if Akali were to jungle (Not saying she would or will) and I threw my q on a monster and proc my q with a basic attack the q damage is 2ce the effect?

No, your Q will only apply damage once, since the mark can only be proced once. Your passive damage will apply multiple times however.

>Or if I use W on elise in spider form does that mean I get double the attack speed?

Once again no. Your spiderform bonus damage will be applied two times when you proc the devourer but you gain no bonus AS other than the 50% on devour and the 140% on Skittering Frenzy.

>And how does it work with other items? Lich Bane/Tri force? I am very confused.

It doesn't. These items can only be used once before going on CD, so procing on-hits again does nothing for them. The items that will work with devourer are {{item:3153}} , {{item:3091}} , {{item:3042}} , {{item:3074}} , {{item:3146}} (recharge), {{item:3087}} (recharge), {{item:3115}} , {{item:3071}} (may require a physical on hit, haven't tested without BotRK yet) and {{item:3022}} .
hydra has an internal cooldown and cant be used to quickly. So it wouldn't work with the phantom attack.
Hydra does proc twice with the phantom attack. Just played a game on the PBE to confirm this.

I thought the same thing. Problem is, for whatever reason, the internal cooldown is only actually activated if the on-hit effect is off of a different target (and really the only typical cause of that being Dragon Shyvana's Twin Bite.

I dont mean to sound dumb but I still dont understand. What does the item do then? On hit effects are what? And about the items how are they getting stronger. I dont understand what the big fuss is about. The only thing I seem to understand is the whole Yi thing. Where he gets more attacks in cause of his passive.

>I dont mean to sound dumb but I still dont understand. What does the item do then? On hit effects are what?

An on-hit is basically anything that applies when you auto attack a target. There's two main kinds. On next hit, which is when your next auto attack has a bonus effect, things like Shyvana Q and Vi E, unless these have a CD related to you auto attacking (like Statik, Shyv Q, or Yi passive) they're unaffected by the item. The abilities that are reduced by attacking are only affected by having a shorter CD, not having multiple instances applied.

Then there's also continuous on-hit effects which are abilities with multiple instances of effect spread between multiple auto attacks. These can be active champion abilities (Yi E, Shyv W/E, Uydr R), Passive abilities (Teemo's E's non-DOT damage, Elise passive, Vayne W) or item effects (Blade/Wits ect.). All of these effects will be applied 3 times every 2 auto attacks with the phantom attack.

A basic way to think of the difference is that the effects that will be affected by the Devourer enchant are those which persist over multiple autos, most effects which only affect one auto attack will not be affected by Devourer.

There's a page on all of this on the LoL wiki http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/On-hit_effect , although they don't differentiate between continuous and on next hit like I have.

>And about the items how are they getting stronger.

In most cases they proc 3 times every 2 auto attacks. Statik Shiv and Gunblade are exceptions, they charge up faster with the new enchant. Frozen Mallet isn't any better really, but it's  technically reapplied for what ever good that's worth.

I heard someone complain about Vayne picking this up...

Because Vayne is totally going to take Smite, buy a 2k item that grants just AS, and farm 30 mobs/15 champs for this effect without being stopped.
Champs only grant 1 stack with it, I believe.
Oh, even better.

> [{quoted}](name=Lil Soybean,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jYEIeGfm,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-06-27T12:37:33.215+0000)
>

> Just my 2 cents.

Actually, tank-Yi became a thing with cinderhulk, making use of his fairly naturally high sustained damage and damage reduction from meditate.

Anyway, on topic:

People remember feral flare. People remember how it was absolutely unfun for anyone BUT the jungler. Say you were a feral flare jungler vs. a non-feral flare jungler. Your team got the joys of fighting a 4V5 for 15-20 minutes while you AFK farmed. The enemy jungler got the joy of working to make ganks work and putting pressure on the map only to end up incredibly far behind because you AFK farmed. The enemy team as a whole got the joy of haveing the opposing jungler appear on the map for the first time and mysteriously do double the damage of anyone else in the game.

And before someone brings up counterjungling to slow down the stacking: we have a jungle item specifically designed to promote counterjungling. Its best use is in labeling players that buy it as noob players, simply because counterjungling is incredibly risky, unreliable, and unrewarding.

> [{quoted}](name=KillerMan2219,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jYEIeGfm,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2015-06-27T20:50:02.359+0000)

I perhaps stated my point badly. Counterjungling as an overall strategy is unrewarding. Grabbing a camp when the enemy jungler shows on the far side of the map is useful. But having your plan centering around counter-jungling is almost always going to end up failing simply because half the time you wander into the enemy jungle only to find it already cleared.

I think the problem champs with this item will be {{champion:11}} and on-hit {{champion:105}}, but like you said they do sacrifice a lot in order to get it, but at the same time the item was bought on them before this buff regardless.

A master Yi doing a Double Strike (which is an on-hit effect) then Phantom Strike with {{item:3153}} (8% HP x 2), {{item:3074}} (20-60% AD x 2),  {{item:3718}} (60 Magic Damage x 2 + 162 True Damage~3 Seconds x 2), Wuju Style (30+20% AD True Damage x 2), and each hit will count as an attack to reset Double Strike, giving him 6 on-hit effects every 3 hits unless I'm terribly mistaken. That's a fuckton of potential damage, not factoring in enemy resistances, Yi's AD/ArmorPen/Lifesteal etc
You forgot challenging smite's damage is a DoT, double on-hit will not increase it's damage

Challenging smite doesn't say that additional attacks only refresh the duration (like Teemo's E) so I can only assume that the damage stacks.

Edit: I'm saying that I think more hits would increase the damage over time (since it doesn't expicitly say additional attacks only refresh the duration). I forgot about the flat on-hit damage it was before. But that's not what I was talking about.

Nah, they changed it specificaly so WW  couldn't abuse it.
Originally it was just on-hit damage and WW would straight up murder people with his ult.
The only DoT I know of that stacks without the tooltip specifying that it can is Naut's W.

Amen. Mindless forum zombies just grouping together to bitch and moan every time a new item/champ/rework gets released.

"LOL RUNEGLAIVE SO OP GG JUNGLE KASS/VEIGAR/ANNIE NEW BROKEN META"

Yeah...and how many of those have you seen so far? Let alone regular AP junglers using runeglaive to begin with? Idiots.
It does not infinitely stack. If anything the current Devourer is the closest iteration of the Feral Flare, the only thing that Sated Devourer has from Feral Flare is the build-up to it.

Last I checked things like teemo Poison and kalye's Righteous Fury are both on hit effects.

This means that every other auto attack when a kayle has this item and a nashors will do (15+.15AP + 60 + .25AP + 40% AD) *2 aka 75 + .80AP + .80 AD. 

This also means that things like Irelia's true damge will proc twice on every other auto attack. you would think I would be happy about it but given how easy many champs will be able to abuse it I am not.

It is just too over the top on some things is the problem. perhaps if it was every 4th attack did it then it wouldn't be so bad but even warwick ult will likely be a problem with this item again just not as soon aka 6 attacks turn into an effective 9.

It is too over the top currently, that is the problem.

meanwhile vayne might do a cheese strategy of 
get to lane and get a botrk then get a dewourer and stack it like mad to just own the late
